Server database module documentation¶

database.py¶

Server Database Description Module.

class server.database.database.ServerDataBase(path)¶

Bases: object

A class describing database tables and server methods.

class ActiveUser(user_id, ip_address, port, login_time)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

The class describes the table of active users.

Stores data: id, user_id, ip_address, port, login_time.

class ContactList(user_id, friend_id)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

The class describes the user contact table.

Stores data: id, user_id, friend_id.

class MessageHistory(sender, recipient, message)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

The class describes a table with the user’s correspondence history.

Stores data: id, sender, recipient, date, message.

class UserStory(user_id, ip_address, port, login_time, logout_time)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

The class describes a table of user connection history.

Stores data: id, user_id, ip_address, port, login_time, logout_time.

class Users(username, password)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

The class describes the table of all users.

Stores data: id, username, last_login, password, public_key.

add_contact(username, friend_name)¶

The method adds the user to the contact list.

Parameters

  • username (str) – username.

  • friend_name (str) – user to add to your contact list.

check_contact(username, friend_name)¶

The method returns True if the username is in the contact list.

Parameters

  • username (str) – username

  • friend_name (str) – user to check in the contact list.

Returns

bool.

check_user(username)¶

The method returns True if the username is in the Users table.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Returns

bool.

del_contact(username, friend_name)¶

The method removes the user from the contact list.

Parameters

  • username (str) – username.

  • friend_name (str) – user to remove from contact list.

del_user(username)¶

Method for deleting a user from the database.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

get_all_active_users()¶

The method returns a list of all active users.

Returns

list of all active users.

get_all_users()¶

The method returns a list of all users and the time of the last login.

Returns

list of all users.

get_connect_history(username=None)¶

The method returns the history of visits of one or all users.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Returns

list of user visits.

get_contact_list(username)¶

The method returns a contact list of one or all users.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Returns

user contact list.

get_key(username)¶

The method returns the public key of the user.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Returns

public key.

get_message_history(sender=None, recipient=None)¶

The method returns the history of correspondence by recipient and/or sender.

Parameters

  • sender (str) – message sender.

  • recipient (str) – the recipient of the message.

get_pass_hash(username)¶

The method returns the hash of the user’s password.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Returns

user password hash.

register_user(username, password)¶

Method for user registration. Writes to the Users table.

Parameters

  • username (str) – username.

  • password (byte) – user password hash.

save_message(sender, recipient, msg_text)¶

The method saves the message to the database.

Parameters

  • sender (str) – message sender.

  • recipient (str) – the recipient of the message.

  • msg_text (str) – message text.

user_login(username, ip_address, port, key)¶

The method is launched when the user logs in. Writes entry information to the database.

Parameters

  • username (str) – username.

  • ip_address (str) – User IP.

  • port (int) – user port.

  • key (str) – public key of the user.

user_logout(username)¶

The method is launched when the user exits. Removes the user from the ActiveUser table and enters the exit time into the UserStory table.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

Messenger
